intro: Ferulago campestris, commonly known as the field ferula, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in dry meadows and disturbed soils. The plant features a tall, branching stem with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The roots of Ferulago campestris contain compounds such as ferulic acid, which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
